items.title: TransitionZero Solar Asset Mapper (TZ-SAM)
items.description: TZ-SAM is an open access, asset-level dataset of solar facilities, powered by machine learning. It contains both footprints and capacity estimates.
items.citation: TransitionZero. TransitionZero Solar Asset Mapper (TZ-SAM) [dataset]. TransitionZero. https://www.transitionzero.org/products/solar-asset-mapper/download (2025).

items.title: PRODES Deforestation Polygons Since 2008
items.description: GeoJSON/Parquet polygons used in deforestation analyses.
items.citation: Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais (INPE). Projeto de Monitoramento do Desmatamento na Amazônia Legal por Satélite (PRODES), 2008 [dataset]. São José dos Campos: INPE. Available at: https://terrabrasilis.dpi.inpe.br/en/home-page/(2008).

items.title: GIST Impact Datasets
items.long_description: This dataset contains comprehensive biodiversity and environmental impact metrics of companies and their assets. It includes the counts of assets in proximity to various stressors including deforestation, urbanization, and climate change impacts. The data also includes risk levels for many of these features, company-wide impacts on biodiversity, and summaries of Scope 3 Emissions from each company.

items.title: Climate Policy Radar Concept Store
items.description: Concepts found within the Climate Policy Radar Knowledge Graph.

items.title: Climate Policy Radar Passage Library
items.description: Passages of policies and laws found within the Climate Policy Radar Knowledge Graph.
items.citation: Climate Policy Radar. Climate Policy Radar Passage Library [dataset]. Climate Policy Radar. Viewable at: https://app.climatepolicyradar.org/

items.title: Brazilian Administrative Boundaries
items.Organization: Instituto Brasileiro de Geografia e Estatística (IBGE)
items.description: Geospatial data for Brazilian administrative districts (Municipalities and States).
items.citation: Instituto Brasileiro de Geografia e Estatística (IBGE). Malhas Municipais – Brasil, 2024 [dataset]. IBGE. Available at: https://geoftp.ibge.gov.br/organizacao_do_territorio/malhas_territoriais/malhas_municipais/municipio_2024/Brasil/ (9/15/2025).

items.title: NDC Align
items.description: A detailed country profile of Brazil’s climate policy response, revealing how far the country is progressing in implementing its targets — and where key gaps remain.
items.citation: Grantham Research Institute. NDCAlign: NDC–Domestic Law Alignment Tool. In collaboration with Climate Policy Radar, JUMA & LACLIMA. Transition Digital.

items.title: Meta Dataset
items.description: Metadata and information about various datasets.

items.title: Science Panel for the Amazon (SPA) 2021 Report
items.description: The Science Panel for the Amazon released the Amazon Assessment Report 2021 at COP26, which has been called an “encyclopedia” of the Amazon region. This landmark report is unprecedented for its scientific and geographic scope, the inclusion of Indigenous scientists, and its transparency, having undergone peer review and public consultation.
items._citation_full: Science Panel for the Amazon. 2021. Amazon Assessment Report 2021. Nobre C, Encalada A, Anderson E, Roca Alcazar FH, Bustamante M, Mena C, Peña-Claros M, Poveda G, Rodriguez JP, Saleska S, Trumbore S, Val AL, Villa Nova L, Abramovay R, Alencar A, Rodríguez Alzza C, Armenteras D, Artaxo P, Athayde S, Barretto Filho HT, Barlow J, Berenguer E, Bortolotto F, Costa FA, Costa MH, Cuvi N, Fearnside PM, Ferreira J, Flores BM, Frieri S, Gatti LV, Guayasamin JM, Hecht S, Hirota M, Hoorn C, Josse C, Lapola DM, Larrea C, Larrea-Alcazar DM, Lehm Ardaya Z, Malhi Y, Marengo JA, Melack J, Moraes R M, Moutinho P, Murmis MR, Neves EG, Paez B, Painter L, Ramos A, Rosero-Peña MC, Schmink M, Sist P, ter Steege H, Val P, van der Voort H, Varese M, Zapata-Ríos G (Eds). United Nations Sustainable Development Solutions Network, New York, USA. Available from https://www.theamazonwewant.org/spa-reports/. DOI: 10.55161/RWSX6527
items.citation: Science Panel for the Amazon. 2021. Amazon Assessment Report 2021. Nobre C, Encalada A, et al. (Eds). United Nations Sustainable Development Solutions Network, New York, USA. DOI: 10.55161/RWSX6527

items.title: WMO State of the Climate in Latin America and the Caribbean 2024
items.description: The report shows that Latin America and the Caribbean experienced record-breaking hurricanes, floods, droughts, and wildfires in 2024, severely impacting lives, livelihoods, food supplies, and long-term water security via glacier retreat (including the complete loss of Venezuela’s Humboldt Glacier).
items.citation: World Meteorological Organization. State of the Climate in Latin America and the Caribbean 2024. WMO (United Nations), DOI:10.18356/9789263113672 (2025).

items.title: IPCC WG1 Chapter 11: Weather and Climate Extreme Events in a Changing Climate
items.description: Reviews observed and projected changes in extreme events—like heatwaves, heavy precipitation, droughts, and tropical cyclones—linking many of them with human influence and providing regional breakdowns of expected trends.
items.citation: Seneviratne, S.I., X. Zhang, M. Adnan, W. Badi, C. Dereczynski, A. Di Luca, S. Ghosh, I. Iskandar, J. Kossin, S. Lewis, F. Otto, I. Pinto, M. Satoh, S.M. Vicente-Serrano, M. Wehner, and B. Zhou, 2021: Weather and Climate Extreme Events in a Changing Climate. In Climate Change 2021: The Physical Science Basis. Contribution of Working Group I to the Sixth Assessment Report of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change [Masson-Delmotte, V., P. Zhai, A. Pirani, S.L. Connors, C. Péan, S. Berger, N. Caud, Y. Chen, L. Goldfarb, M.I. Gomis, M. Huang, K. Leitzell, E. Lonnoy, J.B.R. Matthews, T.K. Maycock, T. Waterfield, O. Yelekçi, R. Yu, and B. Zhou (eds.)]. Cambridge University Press, Cambridge, United Kingdom and New York, NY, USA, pp. 1513–1766, doi:10.1017/9781009157896.013.

items.title: IPCC WG1 Chapter 12: Climate Change Information for Regional Impact and for Risk Assessment
items.description: Explains how global climate findings translate into regional climate information, assessing uncertainties and methods for tailoring projections to inform risk assessments, adaptation planning, and decision-making.
items.citation: Ranasinghe, R., A.C. Ruane, R. Vautard, N. Arnell, E. Coppola, F.A. Cruz, S. Dessai, A.S. Islam, M. Rahimi, D. Ruiz Carrascal, J. Sillmann, M.B. Sylla, C. Tebaldi, W. Wang, and R. Zaaboul, 2021: Climate Change Information for Regional Impact and for Risk Assessment. In Climate Change 2021: The Physical Science Basis. Contribution of Working Group I to the Sixth Assessment Report of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change [Masson-Delmotte, V., P. Zhai, A. Pirani, S.L. Connors, C. Péan, S. Berger, N. Caud, Y. Chen, L. Goldfarb, M.I. Gomis, M. Huang, K. Leitzell, E. Lonnoy, J.B.R. Matthews, T.K. Maycock, T. Waterfield, O. Yelekçi, R. Yu, and B. Zhou (eds.)]. Cambridge University Press, Cambridge, United Kingdom and New York, NY, USA, pp. 1767–1926, doi:10.1017/9781009157896.014.

items.title: MapBiomas Annual Deforestation Report 2024
items.description: MapBiomas RAD 2024 (Relatório Anual de Desmatamento) dataset of Brazil deforestation findings.
items.citation: MapBiomas. Relatório Anual do Desmatamento no Brasil – RAD2024. São Paulo: MapBiomas (Brasil), 2025. 209 pp. DOI:10.1088/1748-9326/ac5193.

items.title: Extreme Heat Indices Derived from ERA5-Land Daily Aggregated – ECMWF Climate Reanalysis
items.description: Extreme Heat indices derived from ERA5-Land measurements. This data represents quintiles of the multi-year mean of the daily land surface temperature temperature over the last five years. This data was prepared by PlanetSapling.
items.citation: PlanetSapling. (2025). Extreme Heat Geospatial Layer (derived from ERA-5) [Private dataset]. PlanetSapling. Derived from Hersbach, H., et al. (2017–present). ERA-5 reanalysis. Copernicus Climate Data Store. https://doi.org/10.24381/cds.adbb2d47
